name: Ebony Wesley
text: My friend went into this store and she bought a shirt with a golden zipper. She realized 2 days later that the zipper has broken. The person who was ringing up her items was treating it roughly. 2 days later, she opened the bag and noticed this problem. She had a reciept, if I may add. So she called Rainbow, and politely explained the situation to them, and she still had a reciept. Rainbow told her that she could not return the item without no tag, they said "On the tag, there is a 7 day return policy". So my question is, why does a simple tag keep a customer from returning a item that is not in good use even though they have a reciept.

name: Cornesia Lewis
text: I want to start by saying the only reason I give it 4 stars is because the staff wasn’t welcoming at the time, love the clothes but it made me want to shop else where because of how the staff was. When I went to try on stuff, which I was iffy about (covid-19), but I have to try on certain stuff. At first i was the only one in the store for a little while before a second person came in, I asked about the dressing room, girl went in to clean it sanitize which I appreciate. But if I’m about to buy something & I’m trying it on why is the staff asking how long I got in the dressing room she knocked on door more than once , like was there a time limit or something? she kept asking me other people need to try on stuff I’m thinking like it’s about 4 other rooms & then they told me once I go in I can’t go in but once.  With that being said I made sure that I took in all what I could & wanted to purchase. Like don’t rush I’m trying multiple pieces, come out it’s like one person with two other people sitting including a man, which he is not trying on stuff waiting. Manager kept making small comments to staff hardly spoke when I came in....I wanted to give them a piece of my mind but wasn’t worth my time,  hence store was only open about 45 mins when I arrived so I don’t want to hear anything about a long day. Would have never went into store but shop online but I needed something I didn’t want to wait To ship only to arrive with limited selection. The world is already in a crisis to have people like this   Someone would love to have your job & customers are what keeping it open.

name: Angi Whatley
text:
My husband and I stopped by this store while we were in Huntsville for some new toys. The blonde sales lady that helped us was excellent. One of the toys we purchased malfunctioned that same evening. The store was closed the next day and we were traveling home (5 hours away) so I called the store on the following day to get a replacement. I left a message with my information. Never heard a word from the store. I called back and I was told I could bring the toy back and they would troubleshoot it and/or replace it. I explained that I live 5 hours away. The sales lady said she would have the manager call me back that same day. I haven’t heard a word from the manager and I am very disappointed in their customer service. I was originally told that the product I purchased had a year warranty and if I had any issue at all to let the store know. This toy was expensive! Buyer beware!!!

Update: the owner of Sultry reached out to me and was wonderful! My toy will be replaced and I am satisfied! This is a very nice store.

resp.text:
Hello Angi,
I’m so sorry you experienced any issues with covering the warranty under Sultry’s 30 days. We tried to follow up the day of (May 7th) but we were informed you were at a graduation and you would not be able to answer. Tiffany  contacted you the next day (May 8th) and left a message on your voicemail that we could ship out the replacement with no issues due to the distance.

I’m sorry there was a hiccup but we always try to make things right for our clients. If you would like to call and continue with the options we left on your voicemail we will gladly follow through with the warranty exchange.

Please contact Tiara to further assist 2568804884.

* Called and left a message today May 15th to provide more assistance.
Thank you

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Very clean establishment. I literally did not see one piece of paper or similar debris on the floor. Shelves were nicely organized with price tags, clearance racks and store personel easy to find. Everyone (employees and customers alike) was wearing their masks and following social distancing guidelines which made the whole experience even more pleasant since I was shopping with several friends including my one year old great niece and a lifelong friend who has an extremely compromised  immune system from struggles with Crohn's disease. Scored a ton of bargains on name brands and designer's fashions. Seriously, I got my great niece a pair of sneakers and a pair of adorable boots for only $2 each. By the way, they were made by none other than the legendary JUICY COUTURE. I would have had to shell out another $45-$65 if I had purchased these designer's labels from elsewhere.  I felt practically criminal after swiping a game carrying case plus a glass screen protector (two separate items) for my son's NINTENDO SWITCH. I paid $5 for both which saved me about $15 and earned me HUGE POINTS with my son. How about this bit of awesomeness: $3 for Beyonce Pulse perfume, 3.4 ounce bottle, normally $15 or more. I also grabbed 2 hoodies for $1 each. And whatever you do, do NOT get me started on the huge savings and discounts I racked up on for the rest of the clothing that I bought as an early birthday present to myself.

name: Patricia Crowder
text: Went into the store to do some shopping today located on University Drive in the shopping Village the mail clerk was very rude after he instruct us to use hand sanitizer and we happen to want to smell it he said ain't no need to smell it I don't know why people come in here want to smell the hand sanitizer and so he said it's not like it's something wrong with it we were just explaining to him that we don't just use any kind of hand sanitizer because some of them really don't smell good and they make your hands smell bad but he was very rude and telling us it shouldn't be free in the first place and we should not come in and smell the hand sanitizer I think it's a personal choice and privilege to do what we want when we want it and to smell what we want when we want to, needless to say it won't be returning back to this location bad customer service

name: Cajan Doll
text: Mostly have skinny girls clothes even thier plus size is fitted small its okay sometimes in prices.

name: MJ
text: Decided to shop at the Citi Trends on University Dr. The reason I visited was to find some summer sandals. The selection was good. The young lady on staff stocking was friendly. The gentleman cashier was matter-of-fact, direct and impersonal.

name: SHERRY WEATHERS
text: I give 3 stars the clothes are great but cashiers are very unprofessional and not friendly at all always playing! I'm probably not going back because its always like this and I just don't like to shop where I'm uncomfortable

name: Darren Brazier
text: Hip selections at decent prices

name: denys martin
text: The clothes are good prices for the quality. They don't really last long.

name: Bridgette Campbell
text: MY SON LOVES THIS STORE. HE HAS GOT ALOT OF NEW CLOTHES HERE AT A GREAT PRICE.

name: Taletha Forte
text: Be prepared to have your previous purchases from another store "held" during shopping experience. Layaway is convenient.

name: Casey Castleberry Southers
text: Great Place To Shop; Trendy & Affordable, Friendly & Helpful Staff

name: Shannon aka Naenae
text: Decent selection of clothing in every size from newborn to big and tall. The staff isn't the most friendly but they aren't mean either its just another day at the job for them.

name: Chris Barnes
text: Citi Trends is ALWAYS cool the only reasons it's not a 5. Too many clearance items had no price tags so the worker grabbed something $19.99 that was new to ring up. That's lazy and unprofessional. Don't treat customers like that so I left with buying nothing. No Stephon Marbury shoes and colognes were completely a disaster.

text: Love there clothes please expand snd open one in Decatur
